meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in rhetoric.
meanings.sent1: The rhetors at the debate club always impress with their persuasive arguments.
meanings.sent2: She studied hard to become one of the best rhetors in the city.
meanings.sent3: The group of rhetors decided to have a pun competition to showcase their skills.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a sword, sharp and cutting, as if he was a master rhetor.
meanings.sent5: The rhetors painted vivid pictures with their words, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: The art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing, especially the use of figures of speech and other compositional techniques.
meanings.sent1: Learning about rhetors helps students become better at public speaking.
meanings.sent2: The book on rhetors explained how to use metaphors to enhance writing.
meanings.sent3: The comedians used their knowledge of rhetors to create hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was a masterpiece of rhetors, captivating everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The workshop focused on teaching the participants the power of rhetors in communication.
